SALESFORCE HELP

VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Improve Page Performance When Returning Data from the API

Squeeze extra performance improvements from your storefront pages and take advantage of deeper integration between the Salesforce Platform and the B2B Commerce for Visualforce managed package. This release refactors the logic that transforms data that a B2B Commerce for Visualforce API call returns: the transformation now occurs within the platform instead of the managed package. As a result, you can provide a faster storefront experience when showing data returned from an API query.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

How: After you upgrade the managed package, the ccrz.ccService.cleanSFFldNames data service provider method invokes platform functionality to transform field names when the API returns data. This transformation removes the ccrz__ namespace prefix and __c suffix so that the return data field name is simplified. For example, the ccrz__CartType__c field becomes cartType.

Optionally, you can revert this change and continue using the legacy transformation within the managed package. Choose this option when you've developed extensions or customizations that are negatively affected by this change. The managed package provides a new storefront configuration, Transform API Return Data on the Salesforce Platform, in the new Salesforce Platform Integration module (platform.maptransform):

If you're upgrading to this version of the managed package, this configuration is FALSE by default to avoid breaking changes with any existing extensions or customizations that you've created. To enable this enhancement, first create the appropriate configuration metadata, and then set the configuration to TRUE for your storefront. Complete the steps in Transform API Return Data on the Salesforce Platform.
If you're installing the managed package in an org for the first time, this configuration is TRUE by default.
SEE ALSO
Transform API Return Data on the Salesforce Platform

title: Improving Storefront Performance with API Integration
